maml:description.maml:para: Export-PSDBSqlDatabase is a wrapper for New-AzSqlDatabaseExport cmdlet with tab completion for mandatory parameters.
Export-PSDBSqlDatabase is a wrapper for New-AzSqlDatabaseExport cmdlet with tab completion for mandatory parameters. It helps you export the database as you would do in Azure portal.
You can save the exported .bacpac file in different subscription by providing values to storage account name, container name and the subscription.

maml:Description.maml:para: Provide the database name that you want to export.
Provide the sql instance admin login user name.
Provide the sql instance admin login password.
Provide the name of blob that you want to save as. If not provided it will save the .bacpac file as it would do in Azure Portal like DatabaseName-YY-MM-DD-HH-MM.bacpac format.
Provide the resource group name. If this is set as default then it is not required to provide when running this cmdlet.
Provide the sql server name.
Provide the storage account name where you want to save the .bacpac file.
Provide Container Name to save the exported database .bacpac file.
By default it is set to StorageAccessKey.
Provide the subscription name if exported .bacpac file have to be saved in different subscription.
Provide the sql instance admin login user name.
Provide the sql instance admin login password.
Provide the name of blob that you want to save as. If not provided it will save the .bacpac file as it would do in Azure Portal like DatabaseName-YY-MM-DD-HH-MM.bacpac format.
Provide the database name that you want to export.
Provide the resource group name. If this is set as default then it is not required to provide when running this cmdlet.
Provide the sql server name.
Provide the storage account name where you want to save the .bacpac file.
Provide Container Name to save the exported database .bacpac file.
By default it is set to StorageAccessKey.
Provide the subscription name if exported .bacpac file have to be saved in different subscription.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Export-PSDBSqlDatabase ` -StorageAccountName "storage account name" ` # tab completion is available for this. -StorageContainerName "backups" ` -AdministratorLogin "admin" ` -AdministratorLoginPassword ('sqlstringpassword' | ConvertTo-SecureString -AsPlainText -Force)

dev:remarks.maml:para: Run Set-PSDBDefaults to set the resource group name, sql server name and database name as default values. Once this is set it is not required to provide these values at the time of export operation.

maml:description.maml:para: Get-PSDBDatabaseData retrieves database tabale data. As the name implies it is suggested to run only SELECT query when you call this function.

maml:Description.maml:para: Provide the database connection string.
Provide the query to run.
Provide the database connection string.
Provide the query to run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-PSDBDatabaseData ` -ConnectionString "Data Source=SqlServer01.database.windows.net; Authentication=Active Directory Integrated; Initial Catalog=Database01;" ` -Query "select * from sys.sysusers"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This outputs the list of users in system table.

maml:description.maml:para: Get-PSDBImportExportStatus is a wrapper for cmdlet Get-AzSqlDatabaseImportExportStatus which checks the status of import or export operation for given status link.

Get-PSDBImportExportStatus is a wrapper for cmdlet Get-AzSqlDatabaseImportExportStatus which checks the status of import or export operation for given status link. Get-PSDBImportExportStatus is mainly built for end to end automation of sql database import and export. This function continuously checks for the status of operation for given status link and waits till the operation completes.

If switch -Wait is enabled by default it checks for the status till the operation completes and if time exceeds than 300 seconds i.e., 5 minutes the script stops automatically. This waiting period can by controlled by passing the interval to check the status continuously and time out after particular time period. Note that all the values have to be passed in seconds.

maml:Description.maml:para: Url where the export or import operation status can be checked.
Provide the time interval in seconds to wait for certain period and check the status of import and export status. Default is 5 seconds.
Set the time out in seconds to terminate the status check operation. Default is 300 seconds.
If this is enabled the script will wait for passed in time period and check the status.
Provide the time interval in seconds to wait for certain period and check the status of import and export status. Default is 5 seconds.
Url where the export or import operation status can be checked.
Set the time out in seconds to terminate the status check operation. Default is 300 seconds.
If this is enabled the script will wait for passed in time period and check the status.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Import and Export operation returns status link which can be passed to this function to check the status.

maml:description.maml:para: Get-PSDBKVSecret is a wrapper for Get-AzKeyVaultSecret modified accordingly to work with PSDB module on ease.

Get-PSDBKVSecret is a wrapper for Get-AzKeyVaultSecret modified accordingly to work with PSDB module on ease. It has tab completion for key vault name and option to select the version. If no version is provided it returns all secrets by default. The value that it returns can be controlled by -AsPlainText switch.

maml:Description.maml:para: Provide the key vault name.
Provide the key vault secret name.
If provided retrieves the secret value as plain text.
Provide the secret version to be retrieved.
If provided retrieves the secret value as plain text.
Provide the key vault secret name.
Provide the key vault name.
Provide the secret version to be retrieved.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $userName = Get-PSDBKVSecret -VaultName "kv-01" -SecretName "DatabaseUsername" -AsPlainText PS C:\> $password = Get-PSDBKVSecret -VaultName "kv-01" -SecretName "DatabasePassword"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Now this can be passed to other functions to export and import database.

maml:description.maml:para: Import-PSDBSqlDatabase is a wrapper for New-AzSqlDatabaseImport which provides tab completion for resourcegroups, sql servers, storageacount and subscription.

Import-PSDBSqlDatabase is a wrapper for New-AzSqlDatabaseImport which helps you to import the database on ease without considering the complexity. Import datase with New-AzSqlDatabaseImport as you would do in Azure portal by supplying ResourceGroupName, SqlServerName, Database Name to import .bacpac file as, storage account and container name.

It also allows you to tab complete mandatory parameters and select .bapac file in storage account of different subscripion. If you specify the storage account name which is different from yur current set context then you have to specify Subscription parameter.

For instance you have selected development subscription in the current context and the bacpac file that you want to import is in test subscription, then you have to specify the test subscription storage account name and test subscription name for -Subscription parameter.

maml:Description.maml:para: Provide the resource group name.
Provide the name of database to import as. If not provided by default it will take the name of .bacpac file.
Provide the sql admin user name.
Provide the sql admin password.
Provide the subscription name to import .bacpac file from.
Provide the name of Sql server.
Default to StorageAccessKey.
Default is Standard. Provide the SQL database edition here.
Default to S0.
Default is 500000.
Provide the storage account name where .bacpac file is placed.
Provide Container Name to import database .bacpac file from.
Provide the name of .bacpac file. If not provided it tries to retrieve latest '.bacpac' file from provided container.
Provide the sql admin user name.
Provide the sql admin password.
Provide the name of .bacpac file. If not provided it tries to retrieve latest '.bacpac' file from provided container.
Default is 500000.
Default is Standard. Provide the SQL database edition here.
Provide the name of database to import as. If not provided by default it will take the name of .bacpac file.
Provide the resource group name.
Provide the name of Sql server.
Default to S0.
Provide the storage account name where .bacpac file is placed.
Provide Container Name to import database .bacpac file from.
Default to StorageAccessKey.
Provide the subscription name to import .bacpac file from.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $impUsr = Get-PSDBKVSecret -VaultName kv-01 -SecretName "SQLUSERNAME" -AsPlainText PS C:\> $impPswd = Get-PSDBKVSecret -VaultName kv-01 -SecretName "SQLPASSWORD" PS C:\> Import-PSDBSqlDatabase ` -StorageAccountName "storage account name" ` -StorageContainerName "container name" ` -AdministratorLogin $impUsr ` -AdministratorLoginPassword $impPswd

dev:remarks.maml:para: Run Set-PSDBDefaults to set the subscription to which you want to import the database or .bacpac file and set resource groupname, server name as defaults. This way you don't have specify these parameter when you call import function.

maml:description.maml:para: Invoke-PSDBDatabaseQuery executes the query for the connect string.
Call this function to run UPDATE, DELETE and other invoke sql queries. Based on the connection string database connection is established and query is executed.

Care must be taken while running this function as it doesn't return any values once the query is exeucted. Running UPDATE or DELETE query can cause database inconsistency and care should be taken before calling this function.

maml:Description.maml:para: Provide the database connection string.
Provide the Sql query to execute.
Provide the database connection string.
Provide the Sql query to execute.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Invoke-PSDBDatabaseQuery ` -ConnectionString "Data Source=SqlServer01.database.windows.net; Authentication=Active Directory Integrated; InitialCatalog=Database01" ` -Query "DROP user [username]"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This drops the user from database.

maml:description.maml:para: Set-PSDBDefaults sets the default parameters in current session or process.
Set-PSDBDefaults helps to set the default parameters used in PSDB module in current session. This helps to tab complete certain parameters such as ResourceGroupName and working with Subscriptions.

maml:Description.maml:para: Provide the default subscription name to set.
Provide the resource group that you want to default. Then for any other parameter where resource group name is mandatory it is not required to specify this. Also it allows tab completion.
Select the level to set the defaults.
Provide the Sql database name to set as default value.
Provide the Sql server name.
Select the level to set the defaults.
Provide the resource group that you want to default. Then for any other parameter where resource group name is mandatory it is not required to specify this. Also it allows tab completion.
Provide the default subscription name to set.
Provide the Sql database name to set as default value.
Provide the Sql server name.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This sets the default subscription in current session and selects the subscription. Once this is set it allows to tab complete the subscriptions consequently.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-PSDBDefaults -ResourceGroupName "resource group name" -ServerName "Sql server name" -DatabaseName "Sql database name"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Once these values are set in current session it is not required to pass these values to export and import functions. It automatically picks up the default values.
